title: AI Safety Messaging Survey (735545) - Complete from XML
description: Full survey with all conditional logic and randomization preserved

questions.question_text: How concerned are you about each of the following issues facing the country today?

subquestions.label: The economy and jobs
Healthcare
Immigration
Crime and public safety
Climate change
Artificial intelligence
Terrorism and war
Housing costs

questions.question_text: Now please rank these same issues from most important (top) to least important (bottom) to you personally.

settings.help_text: Drag or Double click each item from the left to 'Your ranking' on the right.

questions.question_text: Which of the following aspects of AI concern you? (Select ALL that apply)

subquestions.label: Job losses and economic disruption
Privacy and surveillance
Spread of misinformation and deepfakes
Bias and discrimination in AI decisions
Impact on children and psychological development
AI being used for scams and fraud
Companies having too much power over AI
Governments using AI to control people
AI systems making mistakes in important decisions
AI being used in weapons and warfare
People using AI to cause large-scale harm (cyberattacks, bioweapons, etc.)
AI developing goals that conflict with human interests
Environmental impacts of data centers
Other

questions.question_text: Of the concerns you just selected, which THREE worry you the MOST?

subquestions.label: Job losses and economic disruption
Privacy and surveillance
Spread of misinformation and deepfakes
Bias and discrimination in AI decisions
Impact on children and psychological development
AI being used for scams and fraud
Companies having too much power over AI
Governments using AI to control people
AI systems making mistakes in important decisions
AI being used in weapons and warfare
People using AI to cause large-scale harm (cyberattacks, bioweapons, etc.)
AI developing goals that conflict with human interests
Environmental impacts of data centers
Other

questions.question_text: Overall, how concerned are you about the potential negative effects of AI on society?
Which of these statements comes closest to your view?

answer_options.label: AI development should be paused or slowed down significantly until we better understand the risks
AI development should continue but with much stronger government oversight and regulation
Current levels of oversight are about right
There is too much regulation of AI already; development should be less restricted
I don't know enough to have an opinion

questions.question_text: Overall, would you say the increased use of artificial intelligence in daily life makes you feel...
How much, if at all, do you think AI will negatively affect you personally in the coming years?
How much, if at all, do you think AI will negatively affect future generations?
How much would a political candidate's position on AI regulation affect your vote?

answer_options.label: It would be one of the most important factors
It would be a significant factor among several
It would be a minor factor
It would not affect my vote at all

questions.question_text: How much do you trust AI companies (like OpenAI, Google, Meta, and others) to develop AI responsibly and in the public interest?
How much do you trust the US government to effectively regulate AI?

subquestions.label: Other

questions.question_text: When it comes to the U.S. government's approach to AI, which of the following statements comes closer to your personal view?

answer_options.label: The government should prioritize developing AI as fast as possible to compete with countries like China, even if that means fewer safety rules for now.
The government should prioritize creating safety rules for AI, even if that means the U.S. develops AI more slowly than countries like China.

questions.question_text:
How much do you agree or disagree with the following statement?

"I could easily change my mind about the risks of artificial intelligence."

How much do you agree or disagree with the following statement?

"I have all the information I need to form a firm opinion about the risks of artificial intelligence."

On the following pages, you will read several short statements about AI policy. These represent different perspectives people have shared about how society should approach AI development.

After each statement, we'll ask for your reactions. There are no right or wrong answers—we're interested in your honest opinions.

Please read the following statement carefully:

AI is already deciding who gets hired, influencing medical care, and shaping what information we see. We regulate cars and banks. AI should be no different. We need commonsense rules that protect people while allowing innovation to continue.
How convincing did you find this statement?
How did this message make you feel?
Did you find this statement...

Please read the following statement carefully:

AI chatbots have encouraged suicide and triggered psychotic episodes in vulnerable users. People are replacing human relationships with AI companions. These aren't hypothetical risks. They're happening right now. AI products face no independent safety testing before release. That needs to change.
How convincing did you find this statement?
How did this message make you feel?
Did you find this statement...

subquestions.label: Other

questions.question_text:
Please read the following statement carefully:

Millions of American jobs are in jeopardy from AI. Already, the benefits are flowing to shareholders while workers and communities risk being left behind. We need policies that ensure AI helps workers, not just replaces them.
How convincing did you find this statement?
How did this message make you feel?
Did you find this statement...

Please read the following statement carefully:

Leading AI researchers, including many who built these systems, are warning that current AI development practices are inadequate. These systems are becoming more powerful but we don't fully understand how they work or how to ensure they behave as intended. Before deploying AI in critical areas, we need better testing methods and safety standards—the same way we'd want safety testing before a new aircraft carries passengers.
How convincing did you find this statement?
How did this message make you feel?
Did you find this statement...

Please read the following statement carefully:

Decisions about AI's role in society shouldn't be made by a handful of tech executives in Silicon Valley. AI affects all of us, so the public should have a voice in how it's developed and deployed. We need democratic oversight, not just industry self-regulation, to ensure AI serves the common good and doesn't concentrate power in the hands of a few corporations.
How convincing did you find this statement?
How did this message make you feel?
Did you find this statement...

Please read the following statement carefully:

Advanced AI could pose catastrophic risks to humanity. Like nuclear technology, it's too powerful for any one country to manage alone. Without international safety agreements, we face a global race to the bottom. We need binding frameworks now, before it's too late.
How convincing did you find this statement?
How did this message make you feel?
Did you find this statement...

Please read the following statement carefully:

Children are uniquely vulnerable to AI. They're being shaped by algorithms, engaging with chatbots, and deepfakes are being used to exploit them. They can't protect themselves. We need strong safeguards for young people from AI-related harms.
How convincing did you find this statement?
How did this message make you feel?
Did you find this statement...

Please read the following statement carefully:

AI could cause human extinction. We are creating a new form of intelligence that may see humans as irrelevant or as obstacles to its goals. If we lose control of advanced AI systems, it could be the end of humanity. Many leading AI researchers believe this is a realistic possibility. We need a global pause now on the most dangerous AI development.
How convincing did you find this statement?
How did this message make you feel?
Did you find this statement...
When it comes to the U.S. government's approach to AI, which of the following statements comes closer to your personal view?

subquestions.label: Other

answer_options.label: The government should prioritize developing AI as fast as possible to compete with countries like China, even if that means fewer safety rules for now.
The government should prioritize creating safety rules for AI, even if that means the U.S. develops AI more slowly than countries like China.

questions.question_text: Have you ever done any of the following because of concerns about AI?

subquestions.label: Signed a petition related to AI policy
Contacted an elected representative about AI
Donated to an organization working on AI issues
Shared information about AI risks on social media
Attended a meeting, protest, or rally about AI or technology
Talked to friends or family to persuade them to care about AI
Changed how you personally use AI tools based on safety concerns
None of these

questions.question_text: How likely would you be to take each of the following actions related to AI policy in the next year?

subquestions.label: Sign a petition about AI regulation
Share information about AI risks on social media
Contact an elected representative about AI
Donate to an organization working on AI safety
Vote for a candidate partly based on their AI position
Discuss AI risks with friends or family

questions.question_text: What, if anything, holds you back from being more active on AI issues?

subquestions.label: I don't feel I know enough about AI to speak up
I don't think my actions would make a difference
I have other more pressing priorities
I worry that US regulations alone won't work if other countries don't follow
AI development is moving so fast that meaningful regulation seems impossible

questions.question_text: Which of the following best describes how large language models (like ChatGPT or Claude) generate their responses?

answer_options.label: They follow pre-programmed rules and decision trees written by engineers
They search a database to find and retrieve the most relevant answer
They predict the most likely next words based on statistical patterns learned from training data
They understand language and reason through problems similarly to how humans think

questions.question_text:
We are conducting follow-up focus groups to discuss these topics in more depth. Participants will be compensated $35 for approximately 60 minutes.

Would you be interested in being contacted for a focus group?

answer_options.label: Yes, I'm interested (we'll contact you via Prolific)
Maybe, tell me more when the time comes

questions.question_text: Is there anything else you'd like to share about your views on AI or reactions to this survey?
